item.title: Report I-2024070152
item.description:
Report I-2024070152

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-19T00:40:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-30
  • City: SAN BERNARDINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Sequence of Events: On 6/27/2024, the Pressurizer was picked up by BNSF and arrived in Stuart Railyard in Oceanside, California (same day). On 6/30/2024, Pressurizer arrived at the San Bernardino Railyard in California where the leak was discovered by the BNSF rail inspector. On 7/4/2024, Pressurizer transported back to the SONGS Site for repair. Actions Taken at the time it was discovered: Site Emergency Response Team initiated per site procedures. Leak was stopped with the use of JB Weld & Silicon Sealant. Package Failure (including the size and location of holes, cracks, etc.): Manway cover and other sealed openings not completely sealed. Estimate the duration of the release: Two days (very slow leak, approximately <3 liters overall). Mitigation actions (effects of the release): Site investigation identified gaps in the development and implementation of the work package in that no guidance to remediate residual liquids nor re-inspect the pressurizer once it was placed into its shipping configuration to validate residual liquids was still in the pressurizer.

item.title: Report E-2024090335
item.description:
Report E-2024090335

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-21
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1558ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release located at terminal USA in Sacramento, CA. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of UN1760 SHINELINE EMULSIFIER PLUS released from (1) carton containing (4) 1-gallon jugs of product due to the box being crushed by the boxes stacked on top of it. The release impacted the trailer floor, the pallet, and a second carton. ERTS reviewed the SDS and determined that a contractor is necessary due to the corrosivity (Class 8). ERTS dispatched a contractor to perform cleanup activities. Contractors arrived on site and confirmed approximately 1 ounce of product released to 2'x2' area of the trailer floor due to improper loading. Contractors deployed absorbents and sodium bicarb solution to the impacted area to clean and neutralize the release. The damaged bottle impacted cardboard and cleanup debris were containerized to 255-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged on site for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024090315
item.description:
Report E-2024090315

Identified by scraper @ 2024-09-18T09:15:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-17
  • City: KETTLEMAN CITY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0517 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal UKC. It was reported that approximately 2 ounces of Ipex PVC Primer was released from a 1-gallon metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted trailer #3194574. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Terminal personnel generated a 5-gallon poly drum of waste which was staged on site.
